intro: Kadua waimeae, commonly known as the Waimea kōhuhu, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a waxy coating. Kadua waimeae is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky areas.
